intro: Leptocarpus levynsiae, commonly known as the New Zealand sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Goodeniaceae. It is native to New Zealand and is typically found growing in coastal areas, particularly on sandy shores and dunes. The plant has a low-growing, mat-forming habit with silver-blue foliage and small, showy blue or purple flowers. It is adapted to salt spray and sandy soils, making it a hardy species in maritime environments. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important component of coastal ecosystems in New Zealand.
